title: The Best Fashion Instagrams of the Week: Dua Lipa, Serena Williams, Melodie Monrose, and More
summary:
A whole slew of celebrities took to social media to encourage voting in the beginning of the week.
One famous name included Kourtney Kardashian, in a hoodie, who gave her best find-the-light face to the camera complete with an “I Voted” sticker.
Dua Lipa posted a red hot photo of herself before her appearance on Jimmy Fallon on Wednesday.
Among a splash of leaves, she posed on top of a vintage car in a brown puffer vest and white pants.
Like her photo, her caption truly captured a collective mood: “wake me up when this is over.”Here, see more of the best fashion Instagrams of the week.
paragraphs: This week...well, it’s certainly been a wild ride. The drawn-out election, of course, has been the focal point of our lives online and off. A whole slew of celebrities took to social media to encourage voting in the beginning of the week. One famous name included Kourtney Kardashian, in a hoodie, who gave her best find-the-light face to the camera complete with an “I Voted” sticker.

And while ballots are still being counted, people used fashion as a way to drive political messages home. A glowing Gabrielle Richardson aka @FridaCashFlow wore a rose bud-dotted top by Born Supply with the caption that included the words: “black women deserve all their flowers. we’ve seen the data, we know whats going on.” There was also Hedi Slimane-favorite model and musician Julia Cumming of Sunflower Bean who sported a fresh new pixie cut, and took some time this week to deliver food to poll workers through @WorkthePolls. Her clothing of choice? A trusty puffer coat.

Of course, while Instagrams were certainly election-centric, there were chic moments that acted as an escape from reality. Dua Lipa posted a red hot photo of herself before her appearance on Jimmy Fallon on Wednesday. She wore a dreamy look that included a sheeny pink polo and a pair of strappy white boots. In Paris, beloved French mirror selfie-taker Sophie Fontanel gave us some new meaning on how to style stripes, and back in New York, model Kate Ahn gave us the trend of the moment: an exposed yellow thong with low-slung pants and snug jacket by Perverze.

Finally, one of our favorite autumnal outfits came from model Melodie Monrose. Among a splash of leaves, she posed on top of a vintage car in a brown puffer vest and white pants. Like her photo, her caption truly captured a collective mood: “wake me up when this is over.”
Here, see more of the best fashion Instagrams of the week.
